title: Theory of management development
creator_contributor_role: Department of Visual Communication, UCLA, production company
subject_group: Education, Instruction, Teaching & Schools/Management - Study and teaching
Education, Instruction, Teaching & Schools/Psychology - Study and teaching
Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Behaviorism (Psychology)
Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Psychology - Study and teaching
description: Dr. Charles Ferguson presents a lecture about the nature of a manager, discussing some of the assumptions upon which management development theory is based, and the importance of a manager's self knowledge and awareness of the multiple roles he or she performs as a supervisor, a peer, and a subordinate.
